tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NewsNBC They're failing to reduce the stink as it's a daily issue now to smell the nauseating odour three miles away inside our property!

Thank you @TheParksTrust, @EnvAgencySE & @AnglianWater for this interesting article on #MiltonKeynes' flood defences. How long do you think the balancing lakes etc will suffice as the climate changes? https://t.co/1BRgm6OGFQ

I expect we will get into a protracted discussion with the @EnvAgency over what causes theses sewage discharges on the @RiverChess, they know the problem and I know the problem is so lets hope they do not waste my time or insult my intelligence with their usual arguments.

@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NewsNBC Could smell it in the hospital theatre suite and that‚Äôs on the lower ground level where you don‚Äôt get sunlight or phone signal, yet in an air conditioned area you can smell rotting waste from outside.  Doesn‚Äôt that tell you something?  Reported it.

@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NewsNBC The systems they are operating to reduce odour aren't reducing odour, we want fresh air, not reduced odour, we are humans treat us that way #stopthestink @AaronBell4NUL
@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NewsNBC Course they are üëçüèª
@ThamesPathNT @EnvAgencySE @MariaHerlihyEA @brookstreetuk What a fantastic position for a retired Yeoman Warder! ‚ÄúKeeper of Abingdon Lock‚Äù
@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NewsNBC Why do they need to monitor it??! Go outside and use your nose, done.

@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NewsNBC what system are they using to reduce the odour a fucking ambi pur plug in?
JUST SHUT THE FUCKING PLACE DOWN

@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NewsNBC It‚Äôs everyday now - even affecting the hospital wards. Something must be done !! It‚Äôs making everyone miserable and probably ill .
@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NewsNBC Yeah, yeah. That'll be why it's getting worse then.

Mattresses. Sofas. Duvets. Industrial fridges. Bags and bags of plastic. From the River Crane. Decided to take action after authorities failed the environment. @FriendsRivCrane @GuyLambert @CVP_CraneValley @CanLager @HestonActionG @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @LlangattockPick https://t.co/loCt8HiweY
@Amelia28938902 @HealthcareEnv @ScottishEPA @EnvAgency Funny, then, that it is in the sorting hall for an incinerator...
@geoffdoesstuff @EnvAgencyYNE @SheffCouncil That‚Äôs pretty awful. Hopefully it gets cleared up quickly.

@silkstreamers @BrokenBarnet @EnvAgencySE @welshharpies @BarnetCouncil @EnvAgency @CanalRiverTrust @YourRiverBrent @Thames21 @CommUNITYBarnet @RSPBEngland @ben_watt @NaturalEngland Even better would be to come down hard on people dropping litter and fly-tipping to prevent this problem in the first place. Like drink-driving it should be socially unacceptable.

urls.title: Aaron Bell MP
urls.description: ODOUR COMPLAINTS Thank you to all the residents who have either written directly to me today, or copied me in to their complaints to the EA. I am aware that the EA are currently processing an...

tweets.text:
ODOUR

Thank you to all residents who have been in touch today.

Something must have changed in the last week & we cannot wait for the monitoring to be completed before addressing it. I have asked @EnvAgencyMids to consider making a statement asap.

https://t.co/d02VS1igSI?

The criticism directed at @EnvAgency after @RachSalv found that it is removing river pollution targets from performance reporting has been huge. You would think @JamesBevanEA would explain his thinking but he never engages so shouldn‚Äôt be surprised at calls for him to resign.

Fountains of sewage spurting from access chambers on Clifton Ings SSSI today. A regular occurrence when river levels are high, as has been pointed out many, many times to @EnvAgencyYNE, @NEYorksNLincs, @YorkshireWater. 
This is discharge pipe from Rawcliffe STW to River Ouse. https://t.co/2fWesgc9ow
Appears I might not be the only one that thinks there needs to be wholesale change at the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/HxjsbyCtIP

Plenty of barbel anglers on the Severn at Severn Stoke #worcestershire today. 

Catching to help research! Need big fish!

Part of an @EnvAgency Hull University Bournemouth University barbel movements tagging project.

Beautiful conditions 

@BarbelSociety https://t.co/UUfU5aGptw

#WalleysQuarry @RedIndustries2 landfill on Silverdale Road is making the lives of residents in @NewsNBC utterly miserable. In addition to the persistent, widespread, disgusting smell, people are reporting impact on their health. @EnvAgency @AaronBell4NUL please take action NOW! https://t.co/dBe4OsizNl

urls.title: Brexit trade war: Frost prepares to ban EU's bottled water as tensions threaten to explode
urls.description: A BAN on bottled water from Europe could be at the centre of a trade war with the EU initiated by Brussels attempts to punish Britain for Brexit.

tweets.text: My letter to Lord Frost as featured in the Sunday Express urging him to consider a ban on the import of bottled water from the EU https://t.co/ytpVisOxD6 https://t.co/78IwHnSmot

tweets.text: This is a brilliant initiative produced for the North West. Could we do something similar for our region?@EnvAgencySE @WestBerkshire @thameswater @PhialaM https://t.co/8O6zTn4t7k
@EnvAgencySE @Sara_Conway3 @BarnetCouncil @CRTSouthEast So much passing the buck from @EnvAgencySE and @CRTSouthEast Shame on you for leaving the Welsh Harp Reservoir in this state

Keeping our Welsh Harp clean is a responsibility we all share. We are so grateful to our volunteers who contribute every day to reduce the high level of waste generated by years of neglect. 
@EnvAgency @CanalRiverTrust we must all play our part #cleantheharp https://t.co/eYHE85T20g

@EnvAgencySE @BarnetCouncil @CRTSouthEast Thanks. The trash traps need looking at as this happens close by. Litter is obv an issue but the extent of the fly-tipping of large items in the wider area is almost unbelievable. A joined-up approach of collective responsibility and action is long overdue. https://t.co/5B277sIMyS

@Sara_Conway3 @BarnetCouncil I'll get our local team to make contact with you. The volunteers are certainly helping, but you might know #WelshHarp is owned by the @CRTSouthEast. Any other landowner is responsible for maintaining the river area, such as banks and vegetation to control flood-risk. Peter

@Sara_Conway3 @BarnetCouncil Worth saying, Sara, we regularly clear the two trash screens we manage on the edge of #WelshHarp, due to the amount of rubbish they collect. Some online myths about Welsh Harp, incl: ‚ÄúEA's not doing anything.‚Äù People not dropping litter would also help, of course. Peter

@welshharpies @EnvAgency @barnetvolunteer @Thames21 @silkstreamers @ben_watt @Heybournepark @woodcockpark @Natures_Voice @WildLondon @volunteering_uk We couldn't agree more! We are grateful for your volunteers too, what heroes they are ü¶∏ Thank you everyone #PlasticsChallenge
